tags: Title: Demande d'oxygène sur banc d'essai
C fonctionnalité de réduction de la demande en oxygène
full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement - Contract Award Notice

The Department of National Defence has made a contract award notice for the provision of test stand demand oxygen regulators. The solicitation number is W8485-258416/A, and the reference number is CB-18-36867775.

#### Tender Details

*   **Publication Date**: November 21, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date**: December 5, 2024, 2:00 PM Eastern Standard Time
*   **Expected Contract Start Date**: December 9, 2024
*   **Expected Contract End Date**: March 31, 2025

#### Tender Summary

The Department of National Defence is seeking to upgrade and recalibrate 14 test stand demand oxygen regulators. The required items include:

*   Item 1, Upgrade and recalibration of Test Stand Demand Oxygen Regulator:
    *   GSIN: 4920
    *   NSN: 01-607-3762
    *   Part No.: OTS570-2
    *   NCAGE: 58918
    *   Quantity: 14
    *   Unit of Issue: Each
    *   Delivery Location: 25 Canadian Forces Support Establishment (CFSE) Montreal
    *   Delivery Date: March 31, 2025

#### Proposal Requirements

Bidders proposing an equivalent or substitute product must indicate the brand name and model, and/or part number, and NCAGE of the proposed item.

This solicitation will be conducted through an Advance Contract Award Notice (ACAN). The contract award will be made without a competition, and the terms and conditions outlined in the solicitation document will apply.

#### Important Notice

Due to the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, reduced business hours, and limited staff available at the specified bid receiving unit, bidders are strongly encouraged to transmit their bids electronically using the epost Connect service instead of other methods of bid delivery.

#### Contact Information

For additional information, please contact:

Department of National Defence
101 Colonel by Drive
Ottawa, ON K1A 0K2
Dany Lebel
Dany.Lebe2@forces.gc.ca
(000) 000-0000

#### Documents

The solicitation documents can be found at:
